You felt him shudder against you as his hips snapped against you frantically. His lips met yours once again and he moaned loudly into your open mouth as you held him. His eyelashes fluttered against his cheeks like the delicate wings of a moth as he came. You felt him twitch inside you and he held you still for a moment, savouring the sensation, before slowly pulling out of you. He reached down, between your slightly damp thighs, to grasp the condom as he withdrew. You exhaled in a long, deep breath as he moved away from you, turning away from you to remove the condom. You took a moment to gather yourself, suddenly feeling a little ridiculous as you looked at your surroundings and a little ashamed at your lack of self control. You sighed and reached for your discarded underwear, slipping them back on and rolling your skirt back down over your bare knees.

Taehyung had knotted the condom and held it in one hand. He reached for your hand with the other and, with a sweet smile, pulled you to your feet. You brushed your cami and skirt down, smoothing out the fabric as you looked at him, your cheeks and chest flushed. He flashed his teeth in a grin as he reached with his spare hand and pulled a few twigs and leaves from your brunette hair.

“Thanks.” You said, reaching down to pick up your wallet and tote bag. “Here…” You reached into your bag and produced the empty bottle of Cola. “I don’t want you littering.” You kept a straight face, still feeling a little bashful as Taehyung took it from you and discarded the used condom in the bottle. You hid it back in your bag, promising yourself that you would get rid of it as soon as you passed a litter bin. He took your hand gently in his as he lead you back up the gentle slope and towards the deserted forest path.

“Does this mean I can call you my boyfriend?” You asked after a few minutes. You had once more passed the small fish pond and thought you would be able to make it back to the tourist path before it got too late and started to get dark.

He turned to look at you and grinned. His eyes crinkled at the corners as he flashed his teeth. You felt your chest ache once more at how sweet he looked, in the warm light of the afternoon. “I hope so.” He squeezed your hand tightly. “I hope I get to see your play…”

You paused. “Hmm?” Questioning.

“Virginia Woolf. I hope I get to see it before I go to America.”

You smiled and nodded. “I hope so too.” You stood on your tiptoes and kissed his cheek, inhaling his gentle, vetiver scent as you walked along the quiet path, hand in hand.


***

so, not going to mention any names but i was on Quora Digest and someone asked for Jungkook’s number and the person who answered it ACTUALLY gave them his number! What in the actual fuck!? don’t ask for their number, and absolutely do not share it if you “know” it! please leave them alone and stop invading their privacy! these people are humans and you call yourself an army but you don’t give them the respect and privacy they deserve? No. Fuck that shit. That’s fucking stupid and so disrespectful! All of this shit is getting so out of hand. Following them, taking pictures of them, sneaking into their hotel rooms, asking for their numbers. Seriously?! what the fuck is wrong with these people?! STOP. LEAVE THEM ALONE. RESPECT THEM. you wouldn’t want anyone doing this shit to you, correct? this honestly pisses me the fuck off and it breaks my heart more than anything! LEAVE. THEM. ALONE. stop following them, stop taking pictures your not suppose to have, and certainly don’t ask for their number, call them and blow up their phone. that is just beyond disrespectful. ( I’m just using the word “you” in general, i know all ARMYs aren’t like this❤️) and i don’t mean to offend anyone, that’s definitely not my intention. It’s just, these boys deserve the world and they deserve everything good in this world. they don’t deserve this disrespect and invasion of privacy.

thank you for coming to my ted talk.

body:
Rush!BTΣ — college!au, borderline crack au w/ @cynoirsure

a story about three friends and their obstacles of relationships, academic probation, and figuring out that international kids aren’t all that bad.

10/35

genre: crack

word count: 1.5k

—————

YOUR POV

Ever since the last WINGS rehearsal, it was an understatement to say a lot had happened. Following what happened last week with you and Jimin, today was the first time you were out and about for a purpose that wasn’t just eating at the dining hall or going to class. You weren’t feeling the best about yourself but once you walked into the dance studio and saw everyone’s face light up at your appearance, you felt at ease.

“y/n!” Hoseok tackled you in a hug, squeezing you tightly. You laughed, hugging him back with a smile. “How are you feeling? This week was kind of a toll on you, yeah?” Hoseok’s voice didn’t seem to have an underlying tone of anything else like it usually did, so you felt easier around him today. You nodded, pulling away a bit.

“Yeah, it’s been a little rough, but I thought I shouldn’t skip rehearsal because I might miss a lot and you guys make me feel better.” Jimin’s face lit up at this comment, a smile that made his eyes disappear.

“We’re gonna start off with an old routine, yeah? You can chill with Kev and Tae for now, I think 2Jin are gonna come a little later, maybe with Joon?” Hoseok pursed his lips, guiding you to where Kevin and Taehyung were sitting. Kevin was on his phone, but nonetheless opened his arms up so he could hug you from behind. Kevin’s arms rested around your shoulders, swaying you along as the trio (3J, they called themselves) started running over some bits that were kind of muddy to themselves. You could barely concentrate on Hoseok and Jimin dancing – your eyes were focused on how your coconut headed stats partner was in the middle for the first song, his usual bunny smile replaced by a brooding look that could make anyone weak to their knees.

You only snapped out of your trance when you saw a figure open the door and announce she brought some snacks for everyone, but even if your head registered the voice as Jinhee’s, she did not look like Jinhee anymore.

No, instead of the silver it was yesterday when you saw her in the dining hall, her hair was now a bright pink-purple, making almost everyone in the room confused.

“Did you like…give head to a unicorn, what made you dye your hair?” Taehyung asked in awe as you and Kevin gave it a casual lookover and a thumbs up, being used to her random dyeing sprees by now.

“So she’ll give a unicorn head and not me? Boo.” Jimin pouted at Jinhee, who didn’t seem to pay the comment any attention.

“I was just bored of my hair. After my shift last night I just bleached and dyed my hair because I mean, not like I was gonna sleep or anything.” She shrugged, leaving the snack bag and her backpack next to you and Kevin before toeing off her shoes and shrugging off her coat. “I think Seokjin’s coming soon, Joon can’t because he has a meeting with the dean or something.” She plopped herself down, opening the swirl ice cream and casually eating it. You opted for the hot chips in the bag, sharing with Kevin as the three standing started to get into formation. You didn’t even realize Taehyung had gone to do their music until he was running back, the intro of Don’t Wanna Fall In Love by Kyle started playing on the speaker.

You found it really surprising how well the three of them worked together despite their differences in dance style. You noticed that even if Jimin’s dance style lagged a little, it was more sensual and very contrasting to how sharp Jungkook’s movement was.

Speaking of Jungkook, it was hard to make other observations of the others dancing when all you could do was focus on Jungkook. Something about the way he looked really got you in a trance, the way he looked up from his bangs threatening to spill over his eyes, but also the duality when he wasn’t dancing anymore and he gave you the cute little bunny smile that you were used to.

“Jimin! Your dancing was so fluid!” Jinhee seemed to have stars in her eyes when she ran up to Jimin, who only smirked back at her, tilting her chin up maintain eye contact with her.

“Who’s this Jimin, hm? You should follow y/n’s lead and call me oppa.” He swiped his thumb across her lips with a wink, making her tense up and shiver.

“W-what are you talking about?? You’re barely 5 days older than me shut up!” Her face was red as she stomped back to the side, you and Kevin laughing your asses off at how quickly Jinhee had deflected the baffled Jimin. While the two of you were laughing incredibly hard, the door opened once more, and everyone’s attention turned to who had just walked in.

“What’s up with both of the music majors and consistently dyeing their hair?” Jimin furrowed his brows, pointing at Yoongi’s newly dyed mint hair. Once Jinhee and Yoongi met eyes, they almost seemed to have a comedic Spiderman meme moment, pointing at each other confusedly.

“It’s called the depression, Jimin, get on board with it.” Yoongi pursed his lips, sitting closer to Taehyung and Kevin rather than you and Jinhee. Seokjin made a face at Yoongi, before looking at the other musician before snorting.

“Oh cute, they’re grapes” Seokjin laughed at his own observation, taking off his shoes before walking across the marley to meet the ones sitting out. Hoseok had called the rest of WINGS onto the dance floor, beginning to work on new choreography with them. You began to get back into the flow of dancing again, the rest of the group falling back into the routine. Hoseok was busy teaching the choreography to everyone, and occasionally while you guys danced, Seokjin and Jinhee hyped you guys along, some AYY GO OFF Y/N! or OKAAAAAAAYYYYY TAEHYUNG HIT IT! coming from the two in the corner. Yoongi looked like he was losing brain cells by being around them, but the smile on his face really said otherwise.

You felt all the stress from the last week dissipate as you danced more, the emotions rolling off of you as well. By the end of rehearsal, you felt way better than how you felt when you walked in. As everyone was getting ready to leave, you gave everyone hugs, thanking them for the hard work.

“Want to walk back to the dorm together, y/n? It’s kinda late and I wanna just run over what we need to know for our stats quiz tomorrow…” Jungkook smiled sheepishly, scratching his head. You nodded, getting your coat on and waving goodbye to everyone else in the dance room.

“Well, I guess we’re up next, yeah?” Hoseok and Seokjin waved to the five left in the room. Seokjin blowing a kiss to Jinhee (who only took it and threw it on the ground, stomping it), and Hoseok just did his signature smile, leaving with his flatmate. Kevin and Taehyung were already talking about their shared Introduction to Neuroscience course, waiting near the door for the other three to be ready so they could do one last check of the room before leaving.

“Let’s drop Jinhee off first, you’re along the way, right?” Taehyung inquired, Jinhee nodding as she tied her laces so that they could leave. Kevin helped her back up from her squat, a small thank you escaping as they all went to put on their coats.

The walk home was relatively quiet for everyone, mainly because they were walking faster than normal through the cold of campus to get to the dorms. Taehyung and Kevin were in a heated discussion about one person in their class who they both just wanted to sock in their class, Jimin and Yoongi were talking about his cat, Killmonger, and Jinhee was trailing behind them, spacing out.

A block away from Jinhee’s dorm (across the street from the other four), Jimin had noticed that Jinhee had been a lot more quiet than usual, making him stop and let her catch up to him and Yoongi. He tilted his head sideways, making her conscious of him looking of her. Her face turned red, she looked away before peeking back at Jimin to see if he ever broke eye contact with her. Jimin chuckled a little, sliding his hand into hers, the two of them forgetting Yoongi being there.

“You okay Jinhee?” Jimin squeezed her hand gently, Jinhee nodding before letting out a yawn.

“I’m just a little tired, is all. I have the night off tonight so hopefully I can sleep tonight.” Jinhee pulled out her ID, since they were stopped in front of her dorm. She squeezed Jimin’s hand back, bidding everyone a goodnight, and additionally, a small apologetic smile to Yoongi, who’s face only flushed at her small gesture. The only person who had caught that besides the two of them was Jimin, and that only made him grin mischievously. Him flirting with Jinhee just got a lot more… interesting, to say in the least.

2-18-19

“Did you like…give head to a unicorn, what made you dye your hair?” Taehyung asked in awe as you and Kevin gave it a casual lookover and a thumbs up, being used to her random dyeing sprees by now.

“So she’ll give a unicorn head and not me? Boo.” Jimin pouted at Jinhee, who didn’t seem to pay the comment any attention.

“I was just bored of my hair. After my shift last night I just bleached and dyed my hair because I mean, not like I was gonna sleep or anything.” She shrugged, leaving the snack bag and her backpack next to you and Kevin before toeing off her shoes and shrugging off her coat. “I think Seokjin’s coming soon, Joon can’t because he has a meeting with the dean or something.” She plopped herself down, opening the swirl ice cream and casually eating it. You opted for the hot chips in the bag, sharing with Kevin as the three standing started to get into formation. You didn’t even realize Taehyung had gone to do their music until he was running back, the intro of Don’t Wanna Fall In Love by Kyle started playing on the speaker.

You found it really surprising how well the three of them worked together despite their differences in dance style. You noticed that even if Jimin’s dance style lagged a little, it was more sensual and very contrasting to how sharp Jungkook’s movement was.

Speaking of Jungkook, it was hard to make other observations of the others dancing when all you could do was focus on Jungkook. Something about the way he looked really got you in a trance, the way he looked up from his bangs threatening to spill over his eyes, but also the duality when he wasn’t dancing anymore and he gave you the cute little bunny smile that you were used to.

“Jimin! Your dancing was so fluid!” Jinhee seemed to have stars in her eyes when she ran up to Jimin, who only smirked back at her, tilting her chin up maintain eye contact with her.

“Who’s this Jimin, hm? You should follow y/n’s lead and call me oppa.” He swiped his thumb across her lips with a wink, making her tense up and shiver.

“W-what are you talking about?? You’re barely 5 days older than me shut up!” Her face was red as she stomped back to the side, you and Kevin laughing your asses off at how quickly Jinhee had deflected the baffled Jimin. While the two of you were laughing incredibly hard, the door opened once more, and everyone’s attention turned to who had just walked in.

“What’s up with both of the music majors and consistently dyeing their hair?” Jimin furrowed his brows, pointing at Yoongi’s newly dyed mint hair. Once Jinhee and Yoongi met eyes, they almost seemed to have a comedic Spiderman meme moment, pointing at each other confusedly.

“It’s called the depression, Jimin, get on board with it.” Yoongi pursed his lips, sitting closer to Taehyung and Kevin rather than you and Jinhee. Seokjin made a face at Yoongi, before looking at the other musician before snorting.

“Oh cute, they’re grapes” Seokjin laughed at his own observation, taking off his shoes before walking across the marley to meet the ones sitting out. Hoseok had called the rest of WINGS onto the dance floor, beginning to work on new choreography with them. You began to get back into the flow of dancing again, the rest of the group falling back into the routine. Hoseok was busy teaching the choreography to everyone, and occasionally while you guys danced, Seokjin and Jinhee hyped you guys along, some AYY GO OFF Y/N! or OKAAAAAAAYYYYY TAEHYUNG HIT IT! coming from the two in the corner. Yoongi looked like he was losing brain cells by being around them, but the smile on his face really said otherwise.

You felt all the stress from the last week dissipate as you danced more, the emotions rolling off of you as well. By the end of rehearsal, you felt way better than how you felt when you walked in. As everyone was getting ready to leave, you gave everyone hugs, thanking them for the hard work.

“Want to walk back to the dorm together, y/n? It’s kinda late and I wanna just run over what we need to know for our stats quiz tomorrow…” Jungkook smiled sheepishly, scratching his head. You nodded, getting your coat on and waving goodbye to everyone else in the dance room.

“Well, I guess we’re up next, yeah?” Hoseok and Seokjin waved to the five left in the room. Seokjin blowing a kiss to Jinhee (who only took it and threw it on the ground, stomping it), and Hoseok just did his signature smile, leaving with his flatmate. Kevin and Taehyung were already talking about their shared Introduction to Neuroscience course, waiting near the door for the other three to be ready so they could do one last check of the room before leaving.

“Let’s drop Jinhee off first, you’re along the way, right?” Taehyung inquired, Jinhee nodding as she tied her laces so that they could leave. Kevin helped her back up from her squat, a small thank you escaping as they all went to put on their coats.

The walk home was relatively quiet for everyone, mainly because they were walking faster than normal through the cold of campus to get to the dorms. Taehyung and Kevin were in a heated discussion about one person in their class who they both just wanted to sock in their class, Jimin and Yoongi were talking about his cat, Killmonger, and Jinhee was trailing behind them, spacing out.

A block away from Jinhee’s dorm (across the street from the other four), Jimin had noticed that Jinhee had been a lot more quiet than usual, making him stop and let her catch up to him and Yoongi. He tilted his head sideways, making her conscious of him looking of her. Her face turned red, she looked away before peeking back at Jimin to see if he ever broke eye contact with her. Jimin chuckled a little, sliding his hand into hers, the two of them forgetting Yoongi being there.

“You okay Jinhee?” Jimin squeezed her hand gently, Jinhee nodding before letting out a yawn.

“I’m just a little tired, is all. I have the night off tonight so hopefully I can sleep tonight.” Jinhee pulled out her ID, since they were stopped in front of her dorm. She squeezed Jimin’s hand back, bidding everyone a goodnight, and additionally, a small apologetic smile to Yoongi, who’s face only flushed at her small gesture. The only person who had caught that besides the two of them was Jimin, and that only made him grin mischievously. Him flirting with Jinhee just got a lot more… interesting, to say in the least.

2-18-19

When he speaks again, Jeongguk sounds unreasonably sad: “Are you leaving?”

summary: Imagine: Realizing His/Your Feelings Too Late (Hyung Line)   Kim Seokjin: (575 Words) Sometimes he could be a little too much of...
body:
Imagine: Realizing His/Your Feelings Too Late (Hyung Line)


Kim Seokjin: (575 Words)

Sometimes he could be a little too much of a joker, a little too happy and in his own world- just enough to not notice the wistful looks you’d send his way, the playful touching and giggles that you’d turn to whenever he was around. Although, Jin just thought he was that funny. Who wouldn’t laugh at his jokes? There’s no way that your laughter was fueled by something else, right? Right? So, he never paid much attention to it, really, naturally reciprocating your “friendly” nature, not really seeing your intentions, but happy to hold you and surprise you with hugs- much like you did with him. He was just being friendly and he truly thought you were too. The thought that it was something more didn’t even cross his mind- it wasn’t even a possibility, because to Jin, you were in a whole different universe- you were so far above him, him, that he couldn’t possibly see you caring for him in that way. Jin, “worldwide handsome”, only ever felt uncertainty around you. Unsure of himself and his own worth, because he cared so much for you. 

So, it never crossed his mind that you cared for him in that way, not even when he found you crying, crying about some guy who didn’t love you back- not even when you refused to tell him who, said it was someone he knew, but you couldn’t say who- not even then did he consider your actions towards him flirtatious. He only cared about making you feel better, but couldn’t understand when you told him to leave you alone- still not understanding when he saw Taehyung holding you and telling you it was okay- and you let him. 

Kim Seokjin still didn’t understand why you’d suddenly pulled away from him, why all his attempts to gain your attention and affection back failed miserably. He didn’t understand when he left for his military service and you barely said a word to him- and he didn’t understand the whole time while he was gone, and when he got back, he didn’t understand why you were still in Taehyung’s arms, why the two of you seemed a little too close, and little too friendly, a little too flustered at each other’s touches. He couldn’t understand why your lingering looks and flushed expression- directed at Taehyung- bothered him so much. 

He didn’t understand until one of them briefly joked about how you used to have a crush on him- and then everything clicked into place. All the lingering touches and longing looks you’d shared with him- all the laughing and blushing, letting him hold you, falling asleep in his arms while watching a movie- that was all you trying to tell him, trying to show him, but he’d never understood until now. 

Jin would’ve said something about how he never knew, ask you out and hold you close again, try to get back to how things used ot be- how he wanted it to be, but you cast your gaze towards Taehyung, a wide expression on your face, and shook your head quickly.

“That was a long time ago, though. I don’t anymore.”

Jin knew he’d lost you when he watched his friend turn to look at you, his expression cracking into a shy smile as he met your gaze and you looked away, a blush creeping down your neck- and there was nothing he could do to fix it.



Min Yoongi: (620 Words)


You thought you’d made it painfully obvious, even going as far as to tell him how you felt- albeit both of you were always drunk when you did so- so he never really held you accountable for that. Yoongi knew he was close with you and that you meant the world to him, but whether he wanted to pursue you romantically or not he didn’t know. He was so unsure. Unsure of dating you- unsure of how ARMYs would react, unsure of how BigHit and his friends would react- his family, everything about it made him a little anxious, so he pushed away any nagging thoughts whenever you’d sit a little too close to him, whenever you’d share a few too many secret looks. 

Yoongi convinced himself that you didn’t want him and he didn’t want you- that he was content with friendship and friendship alone and he stuck to that. For years, the two of you only got closer and closer as the longing built up, everyone around the two of you able to see what was going on, but not saying anything about it. 

Yoongi was getting more and more stressed- pushing down his own feelings for you for so long he was now convinced that he only had platonic love for you and you felt the same towards him, so he never even entertained the idea of being with you. Only in his dreams, he would see you, hold you, kiss you- you would tell him you loved him and he would do the same, yet every morning he woke up, he didn’t remember what had happened to make a gaping hole in his heart, a dull, heavy aching building in the back of his subconscious. 

He simply couldn’t remember.

He didn’t remember any of his dreams, his mind’s deepest desires showing themselves as he slept, only to safely retreat back into his mind in the morning in fear of rejection.

He couldn’t remember the multiple drunken nights you’d spent together, talking, laughing and holding each other- he couldn’t remember kissing you in drunken bliss, holding you close to him and drowning himself in you.

He couldn’t remember because he didn’t want to. Yoongi didn’t want to feel the burning love for someone he could never have, didn’t want to let his guard down and get hurt- he didn’t want to face rejection, so he never even let himself feel. He ignored his feelings, passed them off as platonic and called it a day.

But when he noticed the looks fading and the space between you two growing- his heart ached dully as his spot was replaced with Jimin. 

Jimin, who’d laugh with you, smile with you, hold you, sleep and dream with you if you wanted him to. 

Jimin who would feel for you- with you- who would fully accept and indulge himself in a relationship, showering you with affection.

Jimin, who would give you everything Yoongi had forced himself not to- in fear of being rejected by the only person he’d cared for in this way, he pushed you away, forcing you to forget what you also considered a silly fantasy.

He didn’t let himself see what was so obvious until Jimin was with you- until it was already too late and until he had already lost his chance, and in that moment, in avoiding rejection, trying so hard to avoid being hurt, he would have been left with his heart broken, and a jealous, burning feeling towards Jimin.

So, to save his friendship-and his own heart- Yoongi went on pretending as if he’d only seen you as a friend. 

As if he hadn’t dreamt of you.

As if he doesn’t still dream of you.


Jung Hoseok: (432 Words)



Hoseok wanted to be happy for you when you first started dating Namjoon. Two of his best friends dating? He should be happy for them, happy that they found each other, happy that you were happy- but instead every time he saw the two of you together he’d have to turn away, ignore the strange burning in the back of his throat at the sight of you two together. He’d do his best to stay positive, but he’d also throw himself into dancing more, trying to ignore any feelings of jealousy that rose up purely out of guilt and confusion.

He’d never felt this way about you before, not that he knew of, at least. He knew he was happy around you- truly, beautifully happy, and he didn’t understand why it was Namjoon. You were closer with him- Hoseok, him- then you were Namjoon, so why were you with Namjoon now?

Why, when the two of you had spent hours laughing together, days, weeks, and months apart made less miserable through hours of calling, texting, and video calling. Why choose Namjoon?

Hoseok had been your first- first love, first kiss, but the timing was wrong, it was off, and nothing wanted to work out.

When everything was said and done- when all the cards were laid out on the table- it didn’t work, there was always some excuse. 

“We were drunk,” , “it was a dare,” , “we were alone on valentine’s day,”- Excuse after excuse after excuse- and it worked. The two never persude anything more than friendship- with an occasional slip up here and there- because he thought you didn’t want to, and you thought he didn’t want to. Because you’d said to each other, after everything happened, we’re still friends, right?


Because Hoseok knows he loves you, but didn’t want to risk mistake platonic love for something else. He didn’t want to see you hurt and have it be his fault- and he wasn’t ready. He wasn’t ready for a realtionship yet, wasn’t ready to let himself fall completely for you- unknowing it had already happened- and so he’d said, yes, we’re still friends.

Because you were, and you are, and you always will be. Nothing would keep Hoseok away from you, in the end, not Namjoon, not his friends, not his parents, not the army or the entire universe, he would force his way into your life if he had to- cling to you and never let go, but, it would never matter, and he could never get hurt, right?

Because in the end, you’re still friends.

Right?


Kim Namjoon: (641 Words)


Namjoon only ever blamed himself for how things had turned out with you. He had actually been the one to introduce you to his friends and Hoseok had immediately asked if he would to date you, how he felt about you, how he saw you, etc. He should’ve seen the way Hoseok looked at you, but everything was happening so fast, he lost time.

He didn’t have time to be with you anymore, always looking after the band, doing interviews, translating and helping the boys learn more English when he could, all while working on new music and learning choreography for concerts (which they were also in the middle of doing). So, admittedly, he had reasons. He had reasons for responding less, not calling you as often, and being more on edge and not as friendly all the time. 

But still, still, if he should’ve seen one thing, it should’ve been this.

He should’ve questioned why you were still over all the time when he didn’t invite you- why your laughter would always be followed by Hoseok’s. He should’ve seen that wherever you went, you were never alone. He should’ve seen Hoseok trailing behind you, tugging at your waist to pull you into a hug- he should’ve seen the two of you tripping and laughing, lightly pushing and teasing each other, the buds of flirting and romance starting to sprout between the two of you, but he couldn’t see it.

Anytime he saw you, you were all he saw. He would be overwhelmed with feelings, and inspiration, and he’d have to write about you- put you into the lyrics and give his heart to the entire world, tell everyone how he felt, but in doing that, he saw you less, you two grew more distant, and you felt abandoned and rejected.

And Hoseok always made you laugh, no matter how sad you were. So, you didn’t mind him trailing behind you all the time, following you like a puppy. You didn’t mind when he’d pull you into a crushing hug, because it made you feel better- it made you forget Namjoon a little more, every passing day.

And every day, Namjoon was writing about you. Pouring his heart out to you, not ready to show you just yet. There was always one line that needed changing, one line that could be made better, one line that could be tweaked just a little, and then it would be perfect. He didn’t want to share his feelings until they were perfectly written out, but as he was writing his own feelings out, getting lost in his heart, he was getting lost from your heart- slowly drifting further and further away the more he wrote, the more he poured his heart out and prepared, the further gone you already were.

Maybe if he’d have stopped a week earlier- a few days even, and you would’ve been his, you would’ve been in his arms, his bed, you would’ve been Namjoon and y/n, and he knew this.

He knew because he saw the questioning look on your face when he played the song to you. He saw the small twinge of pain and confusion when you heard it, words vaguely sparking old feelings inside of you, but everything had come to a crashing halt when Hoseok had thrown his arm around you, placing a quick kiss to your cheek before asking, “who did Namjoonie write this for, hmm?”

But you didn’t have the answer- Namjoon had lost his, so there was nothing to say. Only a shrug and a simple; “for armys,” before leaving the two of you, cursing himself for ever introducing you to his friends, disappointed in himself for being mad at Hoseok, angry for waiting so long to try and tell you- and heartbroken over losing the love of his life, his inspiration.

But you didn’t have the answer- Namjoon had lost his, so there was nothing to say. Only a shrug and a simple; “for armys,” before leaving the two of you, cursing himself for ever introducing you to his friends, disappointed in himself for being mad at Hoseok, angry for waiting so long to try and tell you- and heartbroken over losing the love of his life, his inspiration.
trail.content:
Imagine: Realizing His/Your Feelings Too Late (Hyung Line)


Kim Seokjin: (575 Words)

Sometimes he could be a little too much of a joker, a little too happy and in his own world- just enough to not notice the wistful looks you’d send his way, the playful touching and giggles that you’d turn to whenever he was around. Although, Jin just thought he was that funny. Who wouldn’t laugh at his jokes? There’s no way that your laughter was fueled by something else, right? Right? So, he never paid much attention to it, really, naturally reciprocating your “friendly” nature, not really seeing your intentions, but happy to hold you and surprise you with hugs- much like you did with him. He was just being friendly and he truly thought you were too. The thought that it was something more didn’t even cross his mind- it wasn’t even a possibility, because to Jin, you were in a whole different universe- you were so far above him, him, that he couldn’t possibly see you caring for him in that way. Jin, “worldwide handsome”, only ever felt uncertainty around you. Unsure of himself and his own worth, because he cared so much for you. 

So, it never crossed his mind that you cared for him in that way, not even when he found you crying, crying about some guy who didn’t love you back- not even when you refused to tell him who, said it was someone he knew, but you couldn’t say who- not even then did he consider your actions towards him flirtatious. He only cared about making you feel better, but couldn’t understand when you told him to leave you alone- still not understanding when he saw Taehyung holding you and telling you it was okay- and you let him. 

Kim Seokjin still didn’t understand why you’d suddenly pulled away from him, why all his attempts to gain your attention and affection back failed miserably. He didn’t understand when he left for his military service and you barely said a word to him- and he didn’t understand the whole time while he was gone, and when he got back, he didn’t understand why you were still in Taehyung’s arms, why the two of you seemed a little too close, and little too friendly, a little too flustered at each other’s touches. He couldn’t understand why your lingering looks and flushed expression- directed at Taehyung- bothered him so much. 

He didn’t understand until one of them briefly joked about how you used to have a crush on him- and then everything clicked into place. All the lingering touches and longing looks you’d shared with him- all the laughing and blushing, letting him hold you, falling asleep in his arms while watching a movie- that was all you trying to tell him, trying to show him, but he’d never understood until now. 

Jin would’ve said something about how he never knew, ask you out and hold you close again, try to get back to how things used ot be- how he wanted it to be, but you cast your gaze towards Taehyung, a wide expression on your face, and shook your head quickly.

“That was a long time ago, though. I don’t anymore.”

Jin knew he’d lost you when he watched his friend turn to look at you, his expression cracking into a shy smile as he met your gaze and you looked away, a blush creeping down your neck- and there was nothing he could do to fix it.



Min Yoongi: (620 Words)


You thought you’d made it painfully obvious, even going as far as to tell him how you felt- albeit both of you were always drunk when you did so- so he never really held you accountable for that. Yoongi knew he was close with you and that you meant the world to him, but whether he wanted to pursue you romantically or not he didn’t know. He was so unsure. Unsure of dating you- unsure of how ARMYs would react, unsure of how BigHit and his friends would react- his family, everything about it made him a little anxious, so he pushed away any nagging thoughts whenever you’d sit a little too close to him, whenever you’d share a few too many secret looks. 

Yoongi convinced himself that you didn’t want him and he didn’t want you- that he was content with friendship and friendship alone and he stuck to that. For years, the two of you only got closer and closer as the longing built up, everyone around the two of you able to see what was going on, but not saying anything about it. 

Yoongi was getting more and more stressed- pushing down his own feelings for you for so long he was now convinced that he only had platonic love for you and you felt the same towards him, so he never even entertained the idea of being with you. Only in his dreams, he would see you, hold you, kiss you- you would tell him you loved him and he would do the same, yet every morning he woke up, he didn’t remember what had happened to make a gaping hole in his heart, a dull, heavy aching building in the back of his subconscious. 

He simply couldn’t remember.

He didn’t remember any of his dreams, his mind’s deepest desires showing themselves as he slept, only to safely retreat back into his mind in the morning in fear of rejection.

He couldn’t remember the multiple drunken nights you’d spent together, talking, laughing and holding each other- he couldn’t remember kissing you in drunken bliss, holding you close to him and drowning himself in you.

He couldn’t remember because he didn’t want to. Yoongi didn’t want to feel the burning love for someone he could never have, didn’t want to let his guard down and get hurt- he didn’t want to face rejection, so he never even let himself feel. He ignored his feelings, passed them off as platonic and called it a day.

But when he noticed the looks fading and the space between you two growing- his heart ached dully as his spot was replaced with Jimin. 

Jimin, who’d laugh with you, smile with you, hold you, sleep and dream with you if you wanted him to. 

Jimin who would feel for you- with you- who would fully accept and indulge himself in a relationship, showering you with affection.

Jimin, who would give you everything Yoongi had forced himself not to- in fear of being rejected by the only person he’d cared for in this way, he pushed you away, forcing you to forget what you also considered a silly fantasy.

He didn’t let himself see what was so obvious until Jimin was with you- until it was already too late and until he had already lost his chance, and in that moment, in avoiding rejection, trying so hard to avoid being hurt, he would have been left with his heart broken, and a jealous, burning feeling towards Jimin.

So, to save his friendship-and his own heart- Yoongi went on pretending as if he’d only seen you as a friend. 

As if he hadn’t dreamt of you.

As if he doesn’t still dream of you.


Jung Hoseok: (432 Words)



Hoseok wanted to be happy for you when you first started dating Namjoon. Two of his best friends dating? He should be happy for them, happy that they found each other, happy that you were happy- but instead every time he saw the two of you together he’d have to turn away, ignore the strange burning in the back of his throat at the sight of you two together. He’d do his best to stay positive, but he’d also throw himself into dancing more, trying to ignore any feelings of jealousy that rose up purely out of guilt and confusion.

He’d never felt this way about you before, not that he knew of, at least. He knew he was happy around you- truly, beautifully happy, and he didn’t understand why it was Namjoon. You were closer with him- Hoseok, him- then you were Namjoon, so why were you with Namjoon now?

Why, when the two of you had spent hours laughing together, days, weeks, and months apart made less miserable through hours of calling, texting, and video calling. Why choose Namjoon?

Hoseok had been your first- first love, first kiss, but the timing was wrong, it was off, and nothing wanted to work out.

When everything was said and done- when all the cards were laid out on the table- it didn’t work, there was always some excuse. 

“We were drunk,” , “it was a dare,” , “we were alone on valentine’s day,”- Excuse after excuse after excuse- and it worked. The two never persude anything more than friendship- with an occasional slip up here and there- because he thought you didn’t want to, and you thought he didn’t want to. Because you’d said to each other, after everything happened, we’re still friends, right?


Because Hoseok knows he loves you, but didn’t want to risk mistake platonic love for something else. He didn’t want to see you hurt and have it be his fault- and he wasn’t ready. He wasn’t ready for a realtionship yet, wasn’t ready to let himself fall completely for you- unknowing it had already happened- and so he’d said, yes, we’re still friends.

Because you were, and you are, and you always will be. Nothing would keep Hoseok away from you, in the end, not Namjoon, not his friends, not his parents, not the army or the entire universe, he would force his way into your life if he had to- cling to you and never let go, but, it would never matter, and he could never get hurt, right?

Because in the end, you’re still friends.

Right?


Kim Namjoon: (641 Words)


Namjoon only ever blamed himself for how things had turned out with you. He had actually been the one to introduce you to his friends and Hoseok had immediately asked if he would to date you, how he felt about you, how he saw you, etc. He should’ve seen the way Hoseok looked at you, but everything was happening so fast, he lost time.

He didn’t have time to be with you anymore, always looking after the band, doing interviews, translating and helping the boys learn more English when he could, all while working on new music and learning choreography for concerts (which they were also in the middle of doing). So, admittedly, he had reasons. He had reasons for responding less, not calling you as often, and being more on edge and not as friendly all the time. 

But still, still, if he should’ve seen one thing, it should’ve been this.

He should’ve questioned why you were still over all the time when he didn’t invite you- why your laughter would always be followed by Hoseok’s. He should’ve seen that wherever you went, you were never alone. He should’ve seen Hoseok trailing behind you, tugging at your waist to pull you into a hug- he should’ve seen the two of you tripping and laughing, lightly pushing and teasing each other, the buds of flirting and romance starting to sprout between the two of you, but he couldn’t see it.

Anytime he saw you, you were all he saw. He would be overwhelmed with feelings, and inspiration, and he’d have to write about you- put you into the lyrics and give his heart to the entire world, tell everyone how he felt, but in doing that, he saw you less, you two grew more distant, and you felt abandoned and rejected.

And Hoseok always made you laugh, no matter how sad you were. So, you didn’t mind him trailing behind you all the time, following you like a puppy. You didn’t mind when he’d pull you into a crushing hug, because it made you feel better- it made you forget Namjoon a little more, every passing day.

And every day, Namjoon was writing about you. Pouring his heart out to you, not ready to show you just yet. There was always one line that needed changing, one line that could be made better, one line that could be tweaked just a little, and then it would be perfect. He didn’t want to share his feelings until they were perfectly written out, but as he was writing his own feelings out, getting lost in his heart, he was getting lost from your heart- slowly drifting further and further away the more he wrote, the more he poured his heart out and prepared, the further gone you already were.

Maybe if he’d have stopped a week earlier- a few days even, and you would’ve been his, you would’ve been in his arms, his bed, you would’ve been Namjoon and y/n, and he knew this.

He knew because he saw the questioning look on your face when he played the song to you. He saw the small twinge of pain and confusion when you heard it, words vaguely sparking old feelings inside of you, but everything had come to a crashing halt when Hoseok had thrown his arm around you, placing a quick kiss to your cheek before asking, “who did Namjoonie write this for, hmm?”

But you didn’t have the answer- Namjoon had lost his, so there was nothing to say. Only a shrug and a simple; “for armys,” before leaving the two of you, cursing himself for ever introducing you to his friends, disappointed in himself for being mad at Hoseok, angry for waiting so long to try and tell you- and heartbroken over losing the love of his life, his inspiration.

summary: TW: st*lking, d**th thr**ts,  I’m a bit pissed off at the people(mostly army) making fun of those who “overreacted” to the whole...
body:
TW: st*lking, d**th thr**ts, 

I’m a bit pissed off at the people(mostly army) making fun of those who “overreacted” to the whole sasaeng in the hotel thing. I mean without us “overreacting” what if it WAS a sasaeng? What if we did stay quiet and they’re roaming around bts? What if they harmed one of the members? What if your beloved bias has a real fear of being stalked and harassed by a sasaeng?  

I’m sorry, I rather be safe than sorry! BTS has gotten one too many d**th thr**ts and you just don’t know when that crazy fan or anti will come and do their job! Do you need to be reminded of what happened to John Lennon? Christina Grimmie?! Even if they’re not going to do any physically harm they’re STILL doing mental harm! Did you know st*lking can mentally destroy a person? Have them living in constant fear? Perhaps this wasn’t a sasaeng this time but they’re still out there lurking. :I I just want bts or any celebrity i love to be safe and if we can do something before the worst happens then I will scream to the moon if I can! 

So yeah, to you we may have “overreacted” but to us we’re just being extra safe. Can you blame us after all the sasaeng moments?
